results.adx_keywords: Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Real Estate and Housing (Residential);United States Economy;Interest Rates
results.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Ben Casselman
results.title: We Need to Keep Building Houses, Even if No One Wants to Buy
results.abstract: Right now, builders have too many homes and not enough people to sell them to. In the long term, the United States has the opposite problem: Not enough houses for all the people who want them.

media.caption: “We’re going to look project by project and say which ones are we are going to go ahead on and which we are going to take a pause on,” said Randal Lewis of the Lewis Group of Companies, which is doing work in Chino, Calif.
media.copyright: Philip Cheung for The New York Times

results.title: In Japan, Abe Suspect’s Grudge Against Unification Church Is a Familiar One
results.abstract: The man accused of killing Shinzo Abe said his mother’s huge donations to the church bankrupted his family. Many others in Japan have similar stories.

media.caption: Tomihiro Tanaka, president of the Japanese branch of the Unification Church, during a moment of silence for former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe at a Tokyo news conference last week.

results.byline: By Jesse McKinley and Nate Schweber
results.title: Rare Case of Polio Prompts Alarm and an Urgent Investigation in New York
results.abstract: Health officials in Rockland County offered pop-up polio vaccinations and urged the public to get shots as they investigated whether the disease had spread to others.

media.caption: The health department in Rockland County, northwest of New York City, urged people there to be vaccinated against polio after the first U.S. case in about a decade was discovered.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.title: Google Fires Engineer Who Claims Its A.I. Is Conscious
results.abstract: The engineer, Blake Lemoine, contends that the company’s language model has a soul. The company denies that and says he violated its security policies.

media.caption: Michigan State Senator Mallory McMorrow has raised more than $1 million since a speech she gave in April went viral.
